summaries.body: The Chipotle chain voluntarily shut down 43 restaurants in Washington State and Oregon after health authorities began investigating an E. coli outbreak.

display_asset.caption: Westminster Bridge in London on Monday morning.

summaries.body: Heavy fog enveloped parts of Europe, affecting scores of flights. It was so dense, even fog-hardened Britons took to social media to share photos.
The Communist Party of China has expelled the recent editor in chief of the official newspaper in Xinjiang for openly discussing party policy and for corruption.
A cargo plane on Monday brought the first bodies of the Russians killed in a plane crash in Egypt over the weekend to St. Petersburg.
Thousands of people have signed petitions criticizing Raven-Symoné of "The View" and CNN’s Don Lemon over their remarks on a sheriff deputy’s rough arrest of a student.

display_asset.caption: Members of the Yongshan Persuaders patrolling the Fengtai neighborhood last month in Beijing.
display_asset.credit: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times

summaries.body: No infraction is too small to escape the notice of the Yongshan Persuaders, one of many groups of older residents who use their free time to patrol Beijing.

display_asset.caption: A police car with a shattered rear window at the scene of a shooting in Colorado Springs on Saturday.
display_asset.credit: Christian Murdock/The Gazette, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Officials investigating a shooting in Colorado Springs said they would not release more details until autopsies of three victims and the suspect had been completed.
On his stop in Uzbekistan, John Kerry found himself struggling over how hard, and how publicly, to press one of the harshest authoritarian governments in the world.
A judicial panel that reviewed claims of fraud in Guinea's Oct. 11 election certified that the incumbent, Alpha Condé, had won nearly 58 percent of the vote.

display_asset.caption: Chan Koonchung, author of “The Second Year of Jianfeng.”
display_asset.credit: Shiho Fukada for The New York Times

summaries.body: In “The Second Year of Jianfeng,” Chan Koonchung imagines a non-Communist China, where there is no class struggle, no Great Leap Forward and no Cultural Revolution.

In his first public comments since he lost a finger and severely damaged other fingers in a fireworks accident, Jason Pierre-Paul, the New York Giants’ star defensive end, said he felt lucky to be alive.

display_asset.caption: Before they met, Ms. Queram referred to Mr. Wagoner as her “blogband,” he called her his “blife.”

summaries.body: Two football fans got married after meeting in an unlikely place: The comments section of an ESPN blog. “Once he got there and stopped trembling, he was very obviously the same guy I had been talking to,” she said.
More than 150 cases of a type of Skippy peanut butter were recalled in seven states as a precaution after metal shavings were found.

display_asset.caption: Denis Cuspert, a former rapper from Germany, in Berlin in 2011.

summaries.body: The former German rapper Deso Dogg, who left his music career in 2010 to join the Islamic State in Syria, has been killed in an airstrike, the Pentagon confirmed.

display_asset.caption: Investigators from the California Department of Public Health sprayed insecticide in August to kill fleas in Yosemite National Park after two cases of plague were linked to the park.
display_asset.credit: California Department of Public Health, via Getty Images

summaries.body: The authorities in Oregon have confirmed a case of the bubonic plague in a teenager. Officials have noted a puzzling rise in plague cases across the United States.

display_asset.caption: An aerial view of the Chinese-held Johnson South Reef, which is also claimed by the Philippines and Vietnam, in the South China Sea last year.
display_asset.credit: Department of Foreign Affairs/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: The Philippines has won an important ruling over disputed parts of the South China Sea, with a Hague court saying it has jurisdiction in the case and will hold hearings.

display_asset.caption: Taylor Guerrero, left, and Courtney Wilson.

summaries.body: A lesbian couple filed a lawsuit accusing a Honolulu police officer of harassing them for showing affection at a grocery store.

display_asset.caption: The “Freedom on the Net 2015” report gave China the worst score of 65 nations — behind Iran, Cuba and Myanmar.

summaries.body: China ranks last in the world for openness among countries studied in a new report on Internet freedom by a prominent American pro-democracy group.

display_asset.caption: Tyler Ward Enix with his daughter, Brooklynne.

summaries.body: An Amber Alert yielded a quick arrest in Ohio after a driver heard the alert on his car radio and realized he was behind the suspect.
Iranian authorities are accusing the Saudis of having exploited the chaos of a deadly hajj stampede last month to kidnap Iranian officials and use them as hostages.
Sting and his wife, Trudie Styler, will sell more than 200 works from their art collection at Christie’s auction house in February. The sale will include furniture and a piano.

display_asset.caption: Hillary Rodham Clinton greeted employees and patrons of Moulton Farm in Meredith, N.H., on Wednesday.
display_asset.credit: Ian Thomas Jansen-Lonnquist for The New York Times

summaries.body: Two polls in Iowa and a barrage of Republican attacks have put a spring in the step of supporters of Hillary Rodham Clinton.

display_asset.caption: Freshly-caught Gulf of Maine cod in December 2011. Marine scientists say rising temperatures in the gulf have decreased reproduction and increased mortality among Atlantic cod.
display_asset.credit: Gretchen Ertl for The New York Times

summaries.body: Rapid warming in the Gulf of Maine contributed to the collapse of cod fishing in New England, and might explain why the cod population has not recovered, a study said.
A Dynamic Airways passenger plane's engine caught fire as it prepared for takeoff, and passengers evacuated on the runway using emergency slides. There were several injuries.

display_asset.caption: Quentin Tarantino, center, during a protest against police shootings on Saturday in New York City.
display_asset.credit: Eduardo Munoz Alvarez/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: Philadelphia and Los Angeles police groups joined New York City in a boycott of the director Quentin Tarantino after he took part in a protest against police shootings.

display_asset.caption: RushCard said it was working with Meta Bank, which issues the cards on its behalf, and MasterCard to resolve its technical issues.
display_asset.credit: Fabrizio Costantini for The New York Times

summaries.body: RushCard, a prepaid debit card company, said it would reimburse customers who lost money after technical difficulties cut off thousands of people from their money.

display_asset.caption: Refugees and migrants arrived in Athens on Thursday aboard a passenger ferry from the island of Lesbos. A large wooden vessel capsized in high winds on Wednesday, killing seven.

summaries.body: Greek rescuers recovered four bodies off the island of Lesbos, bringing the death toll from the sinking of a large smuggling vessel to seven. Dozens are feared missing.
European policy makers announced plans to start on-the-road testing of exhaust emissions in 2017, but environmentalists said the standards weren’t high enough.

display_asset.caption: Surrogate mothers rest inside a temporary home for surrogates, provided by Akanksha IVF centre, in Anand town, about 70 km (44 miles) south of the western Indian city of Ahmedabad, in August 2013.

summaries.body: India says it wants to prevent Indian women from becoming surrogate birth mothers for foreigners, according to an affidavit filed with the Supreme Court.

display_asset.caption: Joseph P. Ganim, a former mayor sent to prison on corruption charges, won the city’s Democratic primary last month.
display_asset.credit: Brian A. Pounds/The Connecticut Post, via Associated Press

summaries.body: An election in Bridgeport, Conn., featuring a candidate who used to be mayor before he was sent to prison on corruption charges, has grown into a full-fledged political circus.
